snippet: Airports in St. Louis, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati and other secondary cities are having to address vacant terminals and hangars as they lose business to bigger destinations.
abstract: Airports in St Louis, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati and other secondary cities are looking for new uses for vacant terminals and hangars as they lose business to bigger destinations; although demolition can often be the lowest-cost option, it can still be expensive and out of reach of financially stressed airports.
lead_paragraph: Airports in St. Louis, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati and other secondary cities are having to address vacant terminals and hangars as they lose business to bigger destinations.

headline.seo: Secondary Airports, Losing Traffic, Have Space to Rent
headline.main: As They Lose Traffic, Once Bustling Airports Have Space to Rent
